servinfo.title: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Removal and Installation

attention2.ptxt: Keep the following parts in order. They must go back in the position from which they were removed.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Components:J24B

s1.ptxt: Mark cylinder number on all pistons, connecting rods and connecting rod bearing caps using silver pencil or quick drying paint.
Remove carbon deposits from tops of cylinder bores before removing pistons from cylinder.
Push piston and connecting rod assembly out through the top of cylinder bore.
Remove connecting rod bearings from connecting rod and connecting rod bearing cap, if necessary.

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Disassembly and Reassembly:J24B
Crankshaft Pin and Connecting Rod Bearings Inspection:J24B

item.ptxt: Apply engine oil to the following parts.
Install the following parts in the position from which they were removed.

s1.ptxt: Apply engine oil to pistons, piston rings, cylinder walls, connecting rod bearings and crankshaft pins.

attention3.ptxt: Do not apply engine oil between connecting rod and bearing, between connecting rod bearing cap and bearing.

s1.ptxt: Install connecting rod bearing to connecting rod bearing cap and connecting rod as follows.

s2.ptxt: Fit tab (1) of connecting rod bearing to groove (2) of connecting rod or bearing cap.
Press bearing end (3) until it fully seats in connecting rod and bearing cap.

s1.ptxt: When installing piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore, point front mark (1) on piston head to crankshaft pulley side (2).
Install piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore. Use special tool to compress rings. Guide connecting rod into place on crankshaft.
Using a hammer handle, tap piston head to install piston into bore. Hold ring compressor firmly against cylinder block until all piston rings have entered in cylinder bore.
Install connecting rod bearing cap (1) as follows.

item.ptxt: Before installing connecting rod bearing cap, check connecting rod bearing cap bolts for deformation. Refer to “Connecting rod bolt deformation” under Piston Pins and Connecting Rods Inspection:J24B .
Tighten connecting rod bearing cap bolt (3) gradually.

s2.ptxt: Point arrow mark (2) on connecting rod bearing cap (1) to crankshaft pulley side.
Apply engine oil to bolt thread and seat of connecting rod bearing cap bolt.
Tighten all connecting rod bearing cap bolt to 15 N·m (1.5 kgf-m, 11.0 lbf-ft) evenly and gradually.
In the same manner as Step c), retighten them to 45°.
In the same manner as Step c), retighten them to 45°.
